result.execSummary:
All charges against Quintaous Tavores Williams in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Quintaous Tavores Williams is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Per Remittitur, Dated March 25, 2022, Appeal No. 2018AP002323-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on February 15, 2019, that: 
IT IS ORDERED that this appeal is dismissed for lack of jurisdiction.

Per Order Dated March 24, 2022, Appeal No. 2019AP400-W, 
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of mandamus is granted.  No. costs to either party. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the stay of circuit court proceedings previously imposed in this matter is hereby lifted. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that upon remittitur, the circuit court shall vacate Williams's convictions and dismiss the chargs as instructed herein.

Statements by parties.

As to Count 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 24 months in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to Count 1, with credit for 1,094 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 months and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
- Successfully complete any counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Batterers treatment program. 
- No contact with victim. Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the child/ren.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
  Statements as to sentencing by state and defense.  
As to count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 8 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive,  with credit for 230 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 years and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 years with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  The defendant is to have no violent contact with the victim during his incarceration time.  Once the defendant is released on extended supervision he is to have no contact with the victim except for 3rd party                   contact for time with his child/ren.  
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and his 
        supervision fees to be taken from 25% of his prison wages, remainder, if any, to be paid during his period of extended supervision.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.

As to count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 36 months in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive, with credit for -0- days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 months and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  The defendant is to have no violent contact with the victim during his incarceration time.  Once the defendant is released on extended supervision he is to have no contact with the victim except for 3rd party                   contact  for time with his child/ren.  
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and his 
        supervision fees to be taken from 25% of his prison wages, remainder, if any, to be paid during his period of extended supervision.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 

The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.

.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, credit form, ineligible voting rights form.

Order received, signed and filed.

Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
The jury returned to court to start deliberations at 08:30 a.m.
The court has been assigned 2 new bailiffs this morning.  Deputy Sheriff Pamela Terrell and Detective Luke Chang were duly sworn.  
.
Deliberations began...
.
At the hour of 10:50 a.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson, Sarah B.,  brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO BOTH COUNTS  which was then read.    Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  
As to count 2:  Defense counsel renewed their motion to dismiss count 2.  The court has reviewed their request and denied the motion.
Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
Defendant REMANDED for sentencing.
.
OFF THE RECORD.
After defense counsel and the district attorney left the courtroom, the defendant was requesting something of the court.  The clerk contacted both counsel and they returned to court.  The defendant is requesting to have his phone privileges returned for certain family members.  The court will grant his request BUT ordered that the defendant is to have NO CONTACT with the victim whatsoever, including any contact through a third person. District attorney to provide an order for the court's signature vacating the previous order and reinstating this order.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges

Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab

Jury back in box at 1:25 p.m. 
Trial proceeded.  Witness Karea B., previously sworn, still on the witness stand.  Questioning continued.  Exhibit 3 received.   Sworn in for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer, Wayne Young.  Exhibit 6 received. 
Sworn for the State:  Richard Jacobs, Milwaukee Latent print examiner. Exhibits 10, 11 and 12 received.  Sworn for the State:  Chester St. Claire, Forensic Examiner.  Exhibit 13 received.
.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee County Sheriff's Deputy, Dennis O'Donnell, Special Projects Deputy.  Exhibits 7, 8 and 9 received. Exhibit 14 received. State rests subject to rebuttal.  
Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  
Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Monteal Foster.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  
Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  
Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror Nancy L. selected by lot.  The court released the jury for the evening and instructed them to return in the morning to start their deliberations.
Jury retired at the hour of 4:55 p.m.  in charge of Deputy Sheriffs Detective Donald Desotell and Lisa Freuck  who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
Defense renewed their motion to dismiss as to the December 6th charge.  Court took under advisement.
.
Jurors instructed to return at 08:30 a.m. tomorrow to start their deliberations.
.

Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:10 a.m..

Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  
Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Karea B.  Exhibit  1 received.   
.
Court will adjourn for the lunch hour.
.
Case passed....

Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding the transportation and time of a specific witness.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 11/09/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 36.

Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Quintaous Tavores Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are proceeding to trial.
Amended information filed charging:  Count 1: Felony Intimidation of a Witness (By Person Charged with a Felony), Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 940.43(7), 939.50(3)(g), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(b), and Count 2: Felony Intimidation of a Witness (By Person Charged with a Felony), Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 940.43(7), 939.50(3)(g), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(b).
		  Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Jury back in box.  
The court released the jurors.
